title: Trafficking in Fentanyl
description: Possession, sale, or delivery of 4 grams or more of fentanyl or a mixture containing fentanyl. Mandatory minimums apply.
notes: Sentencing under 2024 FEAR Act. Extremely strict liability.
recidivist_info: Mandatory Minimums apply. DEVIATIONS: (1) Substantial Assistance (O.C.G.A. § 16-13-31(g)(2)) - Judge may reduce sentence if defendant provides substantial help to police. (2) Judicial Safety Valve - Judge may depart from mandatory min if: No weapon, no death/injury, no prior felony drug conviction, not a leader, and interests of justice served.

title: Possession of Schedule I or II Controlled Substance
description: Unlawful possession of Schedule I (e.g., Heroin, LSD, MDMA) or Sched II Narcotic (e.g., Cocaine, Meth, Oxycodone).

title: Possession of Schedule III, IV, or V
description: Unlawful possession of Schedule III (Steroids, Ketamine), IV (Xanax, Valium), or V (Codeine cough syrup).

title: Trafficking in Cocaine
description: Possession, sale, or delivery of 28 grams or more of cocaine/mixture.
recidivist_info: Mandatory Minimums apply. DEVIATIONS: (1) Substantial Assistance (O.C.G.A. § 16-13-31(g)(2)) - Judge may reduce sentence for help. (2) Judicial Safety Valve - Departure allowed if: No weapon, no death/injury, no prior felony drug conviction, not a leader.

title: Trafficking in Methamphetamine
description: Possession, sale, or delivery of 28 grams or more of methamphetamine/mixture.
recidivist_info: Mandatory Minimums apply. DEVIATIONS: (1) Substantial Assistance (O.C.G.A. § 16-13-31(g)(2)) - Judge may reduce sentence for help. (2) Judicial Safety Valve - Departure allowed if: No weapon, no death/injury, no prior felony drug conviction, not a leader.

title: Trafficking in Heroin/Opioids
description: Possession, sale, or delivery of 4 grams or more of heroin, morphine, or opium.
recidivist_info: Mandatory Minimums apply. DEVIATIONS: (1) Substantial Assistance (O.C.G.A. § 16-13-31(g)(2)) - Judge may reduce sentence for help. (2) Judicial Safety Valve - Departure allowed if: No weapon, no death/injury, no prior felony drug conviction, not a leader.

title: Trafficking in Marijuana
description: Possession, sale, or delivery of more than 10 lbs of marijuana. All trafficking carries maximum 30 years imprisonment.
recidivist_info: Mandatory Minimums apply. DEVIATIONS: (1) Substantial Assistance (O.C.G.A. § 16-13-31(g)(2)) - Judge may reduce sentence for help. (2) Judicial Safety Valve - Departure allowed if: No weapon, no death/injury, no prior felony drug conviction, not a leader.

title: Possession of Marijuana (Less than 1 oz)
description: Possession of 1 ounce or less of marijuana.
notes: Often eligible for pre-trial diversion or city ordinance violations in some jurisdictions.

title: Possession of Marijuana (More than 1 oz)
description: Possession of more than 1 ounce of marijuana.

title: Terroristic Threats
description: Threatening to commit a crime of violence, release hazardous substance, or burn property.

title: Criminal Street Gang Activity
description: Participation in criminal gang activity or commission of an offense to further gang interests.

title: Statutory Rape
description: Sexual intercourse with a person under 16 years of age who is not the defendant's spouse. Romeo & Juliet exception applies if victim is 14-15 and defendant is 18 or younger and within 4 years of victim's age.

options.label: Romeo & Juliet Exception (Victim 14-15; Defendant ≤18 and within 4 years)

notes: Consent is not a defense to statutory rape if victim is under 16. Age of consent in Georgia is 16. First offender treatment is NOT available for statutory rape convictions.
recidivist_info: All statutory rape convictions require sex offender registration under O.C.G.A. § 42-1-12. Defendants 21+ receive mandatory minimums under O.C.G.A. § 17-10-6.2, including at least one year of probation after release. No possibility of sentence reduction or expungement.

title: Child Molestation
description: Performing immoral or indecent acts to or in the presence of a child under 16 with the intent to arouse or satisfy sexual desires. Includes electronic transmission of indecent material to a child.

options.label: Child Molestation - 1st Offense
options.other: Lifetime sex offender registration required; no parole for first 5 years

options.label: Child Molestation - 2nd or Subsequent Offense
options.other: Lifetime sex offender registration required; enhanced supervision

options.label: Aggravated Child Molestation (physical injury or sodomy)
options.sentence: 25 years to Life (Mandatory min 25 years without parole)
options.other: Lifetime sex offender registration required; split sentence possible (25 yrs imprisonment + probation for life)

options.label: Romeo & Juliet Exception (Victim 13-15; Defendant ≤18 and within 4 years; sodomy only)

notes: First offender treatment is SPECIFICALLY PROHIBITED under Georgia law for child molestation convictions. Electronic monitoring may be required as condition of probation. Aggravated child molestation requires actual physical injury or sodomy.
recidivist_info: Mandatory registration as sex offender within 72 hours of release under O.C.G.A. § 42-1-12. Aggravated child molestation carries mandatory 25 years without possibility of parole, probation, or sentence suspension for first 25 years. No reduction possible except in extraordinary cases under appellate review.

title: Aggravated Sexual Battery
description: Intentionally penetrating the sexual organ or anus of another person with a foreign object (any article or instrument other than the sexual organ) without consent. One of Georgia's most severely punished sex crimes.

options.label: No Prior Sexual Felony
options.other: Lifetime sex offender registration required; split sentence possible (25 yrs + probation for life)

options.label: Prior Sexual Felony Conviction
options.sentence: Life or Life with Probation (Mandatory min 25 years)
options.other: Lifetime sex offender registration required; mandatory electronic monitoring as condition of probation

notes: Amendments effective May 4, 2023, apply to offenses committed on or after July 1, 2023. 'Foreign object' means any article or instrument other than the sexual organ. Mandatory minimum of 25 years must be served before parole eligibility.
recidivist_info: Subject to sentencing provisions under O.C.G.A. § 17-10-6.1 and § 17-10-7. Split sentences allow 25+ years imprisonment followed by lifetime probation. Electronic monitoring required for all probationary periods for repeat offenders. No first offender treatment available. Lifetime sex offender registration under O.C.G.A. § 42-1-12.

title: DUI - Driving Under the Influence
description: Driving while under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or toxic vapors. Criminal lookback is 10 years; license suspension lookback is 5 years.

options.label: 1st Offense
options.other: License suspension: 12 months (limited permit after 120 days)

options.label: 2nd Offense
options.other: License suspension: 18 months if within 5 years of prior DUI; 12 months otherwise

options.label: 3rd Offense
options.other: License revocation: 5 years; Habitual Violator status

options.label: 4th Offense (Felony)
options.other: License revocation: 5 years; Mandatory 90 days confinement; Habitual Violator status

notes: Criminal penalties use 10-year lookback (date of arrest to date of arrest). License consequences use 5-year lookback for enhanced suspensions. Only convictions on or after July 1, 2008 count toward felony enhancement.
recidivist_info: Fourth DUI within 10 years triggers felony prosecution under O.C.G.A. § 40-6-391(c)(4). All DUI convictions remain on record for life. No first offender treatment available after conviction.

title: Possession of Psilocybin (Mushrooms)
description: Possession of any amount of Psilocybin (Schedule I). No specific 'Trafficking' weight tier exists; high volume is prosecuted as Possession with Intent.
notes: Possession with Intent to Distribute carries 5-30 years (1st Offense) or 10-40 years (2nd Offense).

title: Financial Transaction Card Theft
description: Taking, obtaining, or withholding a credit/debit card without consent.

title: Financial Transaction Card Fraud
description: Using a card that is forged, expired, revoked, or belongs to another.

title: Forgery in the First Degree
description: Knowingly making, altering, or possessing a writing (other than a check) in a fictitious name or in such manner that it purports to have been made by another person, and uttering or delivering such writing with intent to defraud.
notes: Uttering or delivery is an essential element distinguishing 1st from 2nd degree.

title: Forgery in the Second Degree
description: Knowingly making, altering, or possessing a writing (other than a check) in a fictitious name or in such manner that it purports to have been made by another person, with intent to defraud. Differs from 1st degree in that uttering/delivery is NOT required.
notes: Possession alone with intent to defraud is sufficient; no need to present or deliver the writing.

title: Forgery in the Third Degree
description: Knowingly making, altering, possessing, or delivering any check for $1,500 or more OR 10 or more checks (regardless of amount) in a fictitious name or manner indicating it was made by another person, with intent to defraud.
notes: Check-specific forgery for amounts over $1,500 or volume of 10+ checks.

title: Forgery in the Fourth Degree
description: Knowingly making, altering, possessing, or delivering checks that do not meet 3rd degree thresholds (under $1,500 or fewer than 10 checks), with intent to defraud. Classification depends on offense history.
notes: First two convictions are misdemeanors; third and subsequent convictions elevate to felony status.
